titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William E. May photographic collection on George Anderson
May (William E.) photographic collection on George Anderson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-08.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: William E. May photographic collection on George Anderson
did.abstract: Small collection of photographs and other materials collected and created by William E. May, relating to gunsmith George Anderson (1839-1916) of The Dalles, Oregon, and other family members. The collection includes an album compiled by May, consisting of biographical information and of photographs of Anderson guns, as well as loose photographs of an Anderson muzzle-loading rifle.

acqinfo.p: Gifts of William E. May in September 1982 (Lib. Acc. 16084, Photo Acc. 982D121) and January 1990 (Lib. Acc. 19721, 990D003).

prefercite.p: William E. May photographic collection on George Anderson, Org. Lot 659, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

processinfo.p: Album in the collection was designated as Album 652 by the Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

relatedmaterial.p: One photograph received with this collection was separated to Photo File #293, COW-COZ, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

scopecontent.p: Small collection of photographs and other materials collected and created by William E. May, relating to gunsmith George Anderson (1839-1916) of The Dalles, Oregon, and family members.

The collection includes an album that May compiled in 1982, which primarily contains photographs taken by May of various Anderson guns. It also includes biographical information and photocopied clippings about Anderson and his gun shop; about Ernest Kuck, Anderson's great-nephew; a photograph of Anderson and his brother, Alexander Anderson; and a portrait of Kuck. Two additional loose items that were originally in the album consist of handwritten genealogical information concerning the Anderson brothers and descendants, and a copy of a 1924 membership application for the Old Wasco County Pioneer Association filled out by Nettie Anderson Wetle, with genealogical and biographical information. Also in the collection are loose photographs of a George Anderson muzzle-loading rifle.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.
